Text:
[II] Let us worship Christ the Lord. Let us worship the head of our one body. We join together and play our part, when we cry with exultation:
[IR] Lord, Your kingdom come.
[I1] Our savior, continue to make Your Church the living sacrament of unity for people,
[I2] and the mystery of salvation to all nations and times.
[I1] As our High Priest, always help those leading Your universal Church,
[I2] giving to them the gifts of unity, charity, and peace.
[I1] Help all Christians remain closely united to You as our divine Head,
[I2] may we proclaim Your Kingdom by the testimony of our lives.
[I1] Grant peace to the world,
[I2] so calm and safety may flourish in all places.
[IXtra]
[I1] Give the glory of the final resurrection to the deceased,
[I2] and share with us from the overflowing of their blessings.
Changes: 2024-02-04 - Paul Prins: Rework the opening line to fix grammar and keep it readable.
2021-11-16 - Paul Prins: Initial translation of these intentions.
